info.description: The Computer Vision API provides state-of-the-art algorithms to process images and return information. For example, it can be used to determine if an image contains mature content, or it can be used to find all the faces in an image.  It also has other features like estimating dominant and accent colors, categorizing the content of images, and describing an image with complete English sentences.  Additionally, it can also intelligently generate images thumbnails for displaying large images effectively.
info.title: Computer Vision Client

parameters.description: A string indicating what visual feature types to return. Multiple values should be comma-separated. Valid visual feature types include: Categories - categorizes image content according to a taxonomy defined in documentation. Tags - tags the image with a detailed list of words related to the image content. Description - describes the image content with a complete English sentence. Faces - detects if faces are present. If present, generate coordinates, gender and age. ImageType - detects if image is clipart or a line drawing. Color - determines the accent color, dominant color, and whether an image is black&white. Adult - detects if the image is pornographic in nature (depicts nudity or a sex act), or is gory (depicts extreme violence or blood). Sexually suggestive content (aka racy content) is also detected. Objects - detects various objects within an image, including the approximate location. The Objects argument is only available in English. Brands - detects various brands within an image, including the approximate location. The Brands argument is only available in English.
parameters.name: visualFeatures

parameters.description: A string indicating which domain-specific details to return. Multiple values should be comma-separated. Valid visual feature types include: Celebrities - identifies celebrities if detected in the image, Landmarks - identifies notable landmarks in the image.
parameters.name: details

parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Turn off specified domain models when generating the description.
parameters.name: descriptionExclude

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

200.description:
The response include the extracted features in JSON format. Here is the definitions for enumeration types:
 ClipartType
 Non - clipart = 0, ambiguous = 1, normal - clipart = 2, good - clipart = 3. LineDrawingTypeNon - LineDrawing = 0, LineDrawing = 1.

post.description:
This operation extracts a rich set of visual features based on the image content.
Two input methods are supported -- (1) Uploading an image or (2) specifying an image URL. Within your request, there is an optional parameter to allow you to choose which features to return. By default, image categories are returned in the response.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

200.description: The response includes the extracted area of interest in JSON format.

post.description:
This operation returns a bounding box around the most important area of the image.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response contains an error code and a message to help determine what went wrong.
Upon failure, the error code and an error message are returned. The error code could be one of InvalidImageUrl, InvalidImageFormat, InvalidImageSize, NotSupportedImage, FailedToProcess, Timeout, or InternalServerError.

parameters.description: Maximum number of candidate descriptions to be returned.  The default is 1.
parameters.name: maxCandidates

parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Turn off specified domain models when generating the description.
parameters.name: descriptionExclude

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

post.description:
This operation generates a description of an image in human readable language with complete sentences. The description is based on a collection of content tags, which are also returned by the operation. More than one description can be generated for each image. Descriptions are ordered by their confidence score. Descriptions may include results from celebrity and landmark domain models, if applicable.
Two input methods are supported -- (1) Uploading an image or (2) specifying an image URL.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

200.description: The response include the detected objects in JSON format.

post.description:
Performs object detection on the specified image.
Two input methods are supported -- (1) Uploading an image or (2) specifying an image URL.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

parameters.description: Width of the thumbnail, in pixels. It must be between 1 and 1024. Recommended minimum of 50.
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: Height of the thumbnail, in pixels. It must be between 1 and 1024. Recommended minimum of 50.
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: Boolean flag for enabling smart cropping.
parameters.name: smartCropping

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

200.description: The generated thumbnail in binary format.

post.description:
This operation generates a thumbnail image with the user-specified width and height. By default, the service analyzes the image, identifies the region of interest (ROI), and generates smart cropping coordinates based on the ROI. Smart cropping helps when you specify an aspect ratio that differs from that of the input image.
A successful response contains the thumbnail image binary. If the request failed, the response contains an error code and a message to help determine what went wrong.
Upon failure, the error code and an error message are returned. The error code could be one of InvalidImageUrl, InvalidImageFormat, InvalidImageSize, InvalidThumbnailSize, NotSupportedImage, FailedToProcess, Timeout, or InternalServerError.

get.description:
This operation returns the list of domain-specific models that are supported by the Computer Vision API. Currently, the API supports following domain-specific models: celebrity recognizer, landmark recognizer.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

parameters.description: The domain-specific content to recognize.
parameters.name: model

parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

200.description: Analysis result based on the domain model.

post.description:
This operation recognizes content within an image by applying a domain-specific model. The list of domain-specific models that are supported by the Computer Vision API can be retrieved using the /models GET request. Currently, the API provides following domain-specific models: celebrities, landmarks.
Two input methods are supported -- (1) Uploading an image or (2) specifying an image URL.
A successful response will be returned in JSON.
If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

parameters.description: Whether detect the text orientation in the image. With detectOrientation=true the OCR service tries to detect the image orientation and correct it before further processing (e.g. if it's upside-down).
parameters.name: detectOrientation

parameters.description: The BCP-47 language code of the text to be detected in the image. The default value is 'unk'.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

200.description: The OCR results in the hierarchy of region/line/word. The results include text, bounding box for regions, lines and words. The angle, in radians, of the detected text with respect to the closest horizontal or vertical direction. After rotating the input image clockwise by this angle, the recognized text lines become horizontal or vertical. In combination with the orientation property it can be used to overlay recognition results correctly on the original image, by rotating either the original image or recognition results by a suitable angle around the center of the original image. If the angle cannot be confidently detected, this property is not present. If the image contains text at different angles, only part of the text will be recognized correctly.

post.description:
Optical Character Recognition (OCR) detects text in an image and extracts the recognized characters into a machine-usable character stream.
Upon success, the OCR results will be returned.
Upon failure, the error code together with an error message will be returned. The error code can be one of InvalidImageUrl, InvalidImageFormat, InvalidImageSize, NotSupportedImage, NotSupportedLanguage, or InternalServerError.

parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.
parameters.name: body

post.description:
This operation generates a list of words, or tags, that are relevant to the content of the supplied image. The Computer Vision API can return tags based on objects, living beings, scenery or actions found in images. Unlike categories, tags are not organized according to a hierarchical classification system, but correspond to image content. Tags may contain hints to avoid ambiguity or provide context, for example the tag "ascomycete" may be accompanied by the hint "fungus".
Two input methods are supported -- (1) Uploading an image or (2) specifying an image URL.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

AdultInfo.description: An object describing whether the image contains adult-oriented content and/or is racy.

adultScore.description: Score from 0 to 1 that indicates how much the content is considered adult-oriented within the image.

goreScore.description: Score from 0 to 1 that indicates how gory is the image.

isAdultContent.description: A value indicating if the image contains adult-oriented content.

isGoryContent.description: A value indicating if the image is gory.

isRacyContent.description: A value indicating if the image is racy.

racyScore.description: Score from 0 to 1 that indicates how suggestive is the image.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

BoundingRect.description: A bounding box for an area inside an image.

h.description: Height measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

w.description: Width measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

x.description: X-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

y.description: Y-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

CategoryDetail.description: An object describing additional category details.

celebrities.description: An array of celebrities if any identified.

landmarks.description: An array of landmarks if any identified.

CelebritiesModel.description: An object describing possible celebrity identification.

confidence.description: Confidence level for the celebrity recognition as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

CelebrityResults.description: Result of domain-specific classifications for the domain of celebrities.

celebrities.description: List of celebrities recognized in the image.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

ColorInfo.description: An object providing additional metadata describing color attributes.

dominantColors.description: An array of possible dominant colors.

isBWImg.description: A value indicating if the image is black and white.

ComputerVisionError.description: Details about the API request error.

message.description: A message explaining the error reported by the service.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

DetectedBrand.description: A brand detected in an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the brand in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

DetectedObject.description: An object detected in an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the object in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

DomainModelResults.description: Result of image analysis using a specific domain model including additional metadata.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

FaceDescription.description: An object describing a face identified in the image.

height.description: Height measured from the top-left point of the face, in pixels.

left.description: X-coordinate of the top left point of the face, in pixels.

top.description: Y-coordinate of the top left point of the face, in pixels.

width.description: Width measured from the top-left point of the face, in pixels.

tags.description: A list of tags with confidence level.

brands.description: Array of brands detected in the image.

faces.description: An array of possible faces within the image.

objects.description: Array of objects describing what was detected in the image.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

ImageCaption.description: An image caption, i.e. a brief description of what the image depicts.

confidence.description: The level of confidence the service has in the caption.

ImageDescription.description: A collection of content tags, along with a list of captions sorted by confidence level, and image metadata.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

ImageDescriptionDetails.description: A collection of content tags, along with a list of captions sorted by confidence level, and image metadata.

captions.description: A list of captions, sorted by confidence level.

ImageTag.description: An entity observation in the image, along with the confidence score.

confidence.description: The level of confidence that the entity was observed.

ImageType.description: An object providing possible image types and matching confidence levels.

clipArtType.description: Confidence level that the image is a clip art.

lineDrawingType.description: Confidence level that the image is a line drawing.

url.description: Publicly reachable URL of an image.

LandmarkResults.description: Result of domain-specific classifications for the domain of landmarks.

landmarks.description: List of landmarks recognized in the image.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

LandmarksModel.description: A landmark recognized in the image.

confidence.description: Confidence level for the landmark recognition as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

ListModelsResult.description: Result of the List Domain Models operation.

ModelDescription.description: An object describing supported model by name and categories.

ObjectHierarchy.description: An object detected inside an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the object in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

OcrLine.description: An object describing a single recognized line of text.

boundingBox.description: Bounding box of a recognized line. The four integers represent the x-coordinate of the left edge, the y-coordinate of the top edge, width, and height of the bounding box, in the coordinate system of the input image, after it has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property), with the origin at the top-left corner, and the y-axis pointing down.

words.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a recognized word.

OcrRegion.description: A region consists of multiple lines (e.g. a column of text in a multi-column document).

boundingBox.description: Bounding box of a recognized region. The four integers represent the x-coordinate of the left edge, the y-coordinate of the top edge, width, and height of the bounding box, in the coordinate system of the input image, after it has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property), with the origin at the top-left corner, and the y-axis pointing down.

lines.description: An array of recognized lines of text.

language.description: The BCP-47 language code of the text in the image.

orientation.description:
Orientation of the text recognized in the image, if requested. The value (up, down, left, or right) refers to the direction that the top of the recognized text is facing, after the image has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property).
If detection of the orientation was not requested, or no text is detected, the value is 'NotDetected'.

regions.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a region of recognized text.

textAngle.description: The angle, in radians, of the detected text with respect to the closest horizontal or vertical direction. After rotating the input image clockwise by this angle, the recognized text lines become horizontal or vertical. In combination with the orientation property it can be used to overlay recognition results correctly on the original image, by rotating either the original image or recognition results by a suitable angle around the center of the original image. If the angle cannot be confidently detected, this property is not present. If the image contains text at different angles, only part of the text will be recognized correctly.

boundingBox.description: Bounding box of a recognized word. The four integers represent the x-coordinate of the left edge, the y-coordinate of the top edge, width, and height of the bounding box, in the coordinate system of the input image, after it has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property), with the origin at the top-left corner, and the y-axis pointing down.

text.description: String value of a recognized word.

TagResult.description: The results of a image tag operation, including any tags and image metadata.

tags.description: A list of tags with confidence level.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

DescriptionExclude.description: Turn off specified domain models when generating the description.
DescriptionExclude.name: descriptionExclude

DetectOrientation.description: Whether detect the text orientation in the image. With detectOrientation=true the OCR service tries to detect the image orientation and correct it before further processing (e.g. if it's upside-down).
DetectOrientation.name: detectOrientation

OcrLanguage.description: The BCP-47 language code of the text to be detected in the image. The default value is 'unk'.
OcrLanguage.name: language

ServiceLanguage.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.
ServiceLanguage.name: language

VisualFeatures.description: A string indicating what visual feature types to return. Multiple values should be comma-separated. Valid visual feature types include: Categories - categorizes image content according to a taxonomy defined in documentation. Tags - tags the image with a detailed list of words related to the image content. Description - describes the image content with a complete English sentence. Faces - detects if faces are present. If present, generate coordinates, gender and age. ImageType - detects if image is clipart or a line drawing. Color - determines the accent color, dominant color, and whether an image is black&white. Adult - detects if the image is pornographic in nature (depicts nudity or a sex act), or is gory (depicts extreme violence or blood). Sexually suggestive content (aka racy content) is also detected. Objects - detects various objects within an image, including the approximate location. The Objects argument is only available in English. Brands - detects various brands within an image, including the approximate location. The Brands argument is only available in English.
VisualFeatures.name: visualFeatures

captions.text: Satya Nadella sitting on a bench
Satya Nadella sitting on a bench
Satya Nadella is sitting on a bench
Satya Nadella sitting in front of a building

ImageUrl.description: A JSON document with a URL pointing to the image that is to be analyzed.

This operation generates a list of words, or tags, that are relevant to the content of the supplied image. The Computer Vision API can return tags based on objects, living beings, scenery or actions found in images. Unlike categories, tags are not organized according to a hierarchical classification system, but correspond to image content. Tags may contain hints to avoid ambiguity or provide context, for example the tag "ascomycete" may be accompanied by the hint "fungus".
Two input methods are supported -- (1) Uploading an image or (2) specifying an image URL.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.
